question: The magnitude of the resultant of two vectors is maximum in which of the following case?
option1: when vectors act in the same direction
option2: when vectors act in the opposite direction
option3: when vectors act at 90Â° to each other
answer: when vectors act in the same direction
explanation: The magnitude of the resultant of two vectors is maximum when vectors act in the same direction. The magnitude of the resultant of two vectors is minimum when vectors act in the opposite directions.
